comment.text:
Forget everything you thought you knew about fried chicken. Mukja isn't just serving up clucking good food; they're orchestrating a symphony of flavor that will have your taste buds in another world.

The real stars of the show are the chickens, each piece a crispy, golden masterpiece. Gone are the days of greasy, soggy mediocrity. Their double-frying technique creates a shatteringly perfect crust that yields to reveal juicy, tender meat inside. But the magic doesn't stop there. Their selection of sauces is like a flavor explosion in your mouth. The classic soy garlic is a sweet and savory dream, while the spicy marinade sends your taste buds on a thrilling rollercoaster ride.

But Mukja isn't just about the chicken (although, let's be honest, it could be). Their sides are an ode to Korean culinary delights. Kimchi mac and cheese, is the ideal counterpoint to the richness of the chicken. 

And let's not forget the service! The staff is as friendly and welcoming. They're happy to answer your questions, guide you through the menu, and ensure your experience is nothing short of delightful.

Whether you're a seasoned Korean food aficionado or a curious newbie, Mukja is a must-try. It's the perfect spot for a casual weeknight dinner, a fun gathering with friends, or even a date night. Just be warned: one bite, and you'll be hooked!

My son loved this place for me if I get the Bird On a Bun again I will get the Comeback Sauce on the side as they tend to drench the sandwich in it. Overall if you like Crispy chicken then this place is a 8/10!

We went to closing during the week this time and were reminded by the cashier that the dining room would be closing in 40 minutes and the restaurant in an hour and we would have to leave, I was confused and had to ask if our food would come out before then and she informed us that the food would be out in ten minutes but she likes to let people know.

The Korean fried chicken was   
The crunch, juiciness, seasoning, the size. 
I loved the Korean Sweet Heat sauce to dip the chicken and fries in. 
The fries were very tasty, salty and crispy. 

The Mac & Cheese was not tasty at all but I'm sure someone would like it. 

The menu is simplistic. I appreciated the sauce being on the side versus cooked in. 

Ambiance was nothing special but I appreciate the cleanliness and simplicity.

Wow the fried chicken was amazing. It was rich, crispy, and moist. I was expecting some degree of dryness but there was none.

Their Mukja bowl was also quite good and was a good balance of flavors.

Only complaint was the mac and cheese. The kimchi and Mac and cheese was not a good combo
Fast service, good service,  good location...they need more locations. I love that damn chicken sandwich.

I got their wings with two sauces, the sweet chili and the soy garlic. The wings were extremely crispy and had a great crunch, but were on the small side.
The Loaded fries was tasty and had a great balance of toppings and textures. The corn cheese was not my cup of tea, the cheese was a bit congealed. Overall, if you're craving Korean fried chicken, would recommend.

Not sure if it's cause of delivery... But for the price I'd paid. You would expect this meal to be bigger portions? 

I felt like the value just isn't there. If it was solely base on their technique and gave a different type of flavors compared to many fried chicken spots. I would've been okay with that, sadly it wasn't. 

The chicken was sadly dry and the mini sides were easily forgettable. 

Hopefully if we choose this next time around with our company. It'll be better.

It was my first time trying something like this. It was different yet tasty and a bit on the spicy side. 

If I were a spice girl, this place would definitely be at the top of my list! However, I'm not but I still forged through. The flavors are yummy and a, I would have never thought of this but surprisingly, it works!

The space coming in was cool too, very modern chic. Unfortunately, on the day that I went the staff there wasn't as helpful. In a place so unique like this,  it is imperative that someone greets you and when you tell them that you've never been here before, give you insight on what's in store and maybe offer suggestions. That didn't happen at all,  it was more so, please know what you want before ordering because I don't have the patience or willingness to assist.

Outside of that (which is a big thing because if anyone has read my reviews we all know that friendly staff is major on my list of feeling like me and my money is appreciated and for whether or not I'll return, share and invite others since I always have family and friends coming into town. 

Now although I live about 20 plus minutes away, I still wouldn't mind giving them another try with someone who has a palette for their food combinations. Meaning I'm willing to refer and bring someone else there to give them a chance to
 experience it.

Until next time, enjoy the food pics below.

photos.caption: Mac & Cheese Fries w/ Comeback Sauce Korean Slaw

comment.text: Went to Mukja for the first time for lunch today. I had the wings which I thought were very good. Super crispy and crunchy, just the way I like them. My husband had the bird on a bun and he said it was just ok. I didn't try it. We had the cheesy corn and it wasn't very good. Also the Korean slaw was good but a bit too spicy for my taste but if you like spicy you'll probably love it. The inside is pretty cool with the murals. The soda machine was basically out of all of the drinks my husband and I would have preferred. And just a heads up it's a cashless business. Overall it was just an OK dining experience.

This is a hidden gem in Midtown, let's discuss! 

Location and Parking 
Mukja is located in the Metropolis building in Midtown, next to Sweet Hut. They validate parking for 2 hours in the Metropolis deck. 

Venue and Atmosphere 
The decor is sleek, simple, and clean. You order at the counter and wait for your food. They have a Coca-Cola Freestyle machine (win!) as well as canned alcoholic beverages. 

Service 
The employees were kind, professional, and helpful. Food was served promptly. 

Food and Beverages 
My date and I shared the wings, mac and cheese, tofu rice bowl, and Korean Slaw. I will say the mac and cheese was very creamy and flavorful; it was mixed with kimchi. Restaurant mac and cheese can be hit or miss and this was surprisingly good. The wings were well seasoned and crispy. The Korean slaw is plain and requires sauce; the soy garlic and sweet heat mixed well. The tofu rice ball was also delish; I don't usually eat tofu so I don't have a comparison point for the flavor, but I did enjoy it. My only complaint is that the Freestyle drink machine was missing several flavors... I was craving an Arnold Palmer with peach lemonade lol. 

Verdict 
I will certainly be back to try their signature bird on a bun fried chicken sandwich!

This is a great fast casual korean fried chicken spot. We got a half bird which comes with 3 sides and pickled radish! The server at the counter was welcoming and order came out pretty quick. There were many tables and chairs even around dinner time.

The bird was a mixed of white and dark meat but didn't taste dry. They had awesome Korean slaw salad with a strong taste of gochujang, kimchi mac and cheese with Gouda and cheese corn!

Overall, this is a great spot for a quick bite and fusion flavors!

photos.caption: Pickled radish, Korean slaw, cheese corn, kimchi Mac & Cheese and Half Bird

comment.text: The service was good, there's a lot of seating in the place with a casual vibe. The fries were a bit cold, but still crispy, the chicken batter was really well seasoned but kept slipping off of the chicken with every bite. I got the hot honey, and it had a good kick that wasn't too overpowering for the honey sweetness. The batter was good, just annoying biting into. Would come here again to try the other flavors !

Phenomenal, super crispy wings, tasty sauce, and crunchy fries. The ambience is definitely cool too for a casual meal- murals, photos, and mellow hip hop playing made for a great time as we enjoyed the best wings I have had in Atlanta!

2 orders of 10 piece wings ...with sides...tiny.. tiny wings pieces...
To go ... what a surprise and a big disappointment ... I really have to think about going back there again... so dissatisfied and embarrassed for my guests.

I wanted to love this place because of the great reviews and super cute decor, but the food was average for me. The chicken tenders were very juicy, hot, and crunchy, but the breading lacked flavor. The sweet and spicy sauce was pretty good, but it was a little too sweet in my opinion. I absolutely loved the korean slaw - this was the star of the meal for me. The dressing was like a gochujang mixed with sesame oil, and it was so flavorful. The corn cheese was very disappointing. Pieces of corn were floating in this super salty liquid that did not taste very cheesy at all.

This place is in midtown and validates parking. It's a counter serve spot with Korean fried chicken  we got the wings which were cooked perfectly but maybe needed more seasoning for my taste buds. The chicken on a bun was done well and perfect balance of flavors. Each of these dishes came with a side and we liked the Mac and cheese. But want to try the loaded fries. Heads up the sauces (Korean sweet heat and comeback)are on the sweeter side too. So the food is not spicy.

the fires were soooo good!! And the sauce was really good too!!
The chicken was nice I just wish they add some type of sauce on them? I think they'll be great after that

photos.caption: Kimchi Fries w/ Comeback Sauce and chicken

comment.text: This was probably the best fried chicken I ever had mixed with the sweet Korean chili it definitely sent me to flavor town!!

Ah KFC - and I'm not referring to the imposter Colonel Sanders KFC. I'm talking about KFC near and dear to my heart: Korean Fried Chicken. Fun fact: fried chicken was first introduced to Korea when the American military set foot and stationed on Korean soil during the Korean War in the late 1940s. The US troops that were stationed in Korea during Thanksgiving only had chicken instead of turkey to celebrate - and the rest, as they say, is history

In the case of Mukja (which means "Let's Eat" in Korean), two entrepreneurial friends (Peter and Sean) wanted to create a business that stood out while also drawing upon their vast restaurant experience. They decided to put their talents together, one thing led to the next, and ultimately Mukja KFC was born.

There's something about every KFC joint that hits you slightly different. Maybe its the fact that the chicken is double fried that leads to a delightful crunch- or maybe it's how the chicken is usually tossed in sauces with sweet/spicy/savory notes along with a proprietary secret batter.

Brining the chicken, in my humble opinion, is the missing step at most KFC joints. Thankfully, Mukja, actually leverages the power of a brine for all their chicken before the entire cooking process starts. The result is a wonderful, flavorful, and MOIST piece of chicken for every crunchy bite. 

While KFC is not the healthiest food choice, make sure you get some exercise in that day to eat everything relatively guilt-free e.g., hit the gym, run around your neighborhood, or twerk upside down (my personal favorite).

My party ordered the whole bird which had dark/white meat and comes with 4 sides, 2 large specialty sauces, and pickled Korean radish. We decided on the Soy Garlic and Sweet Heat sauces along with the Korean Loaded Fries, the Korean Slaw, Cheese Corn, and the Mac & Chz. Everything was great but my favorite side was definitely the Mac - which used a smoked gouda sauce topped with roasted Kimchi. 

If you're looking for KFC in Atlanta, look no further than Mukja. Kudos to the owners for introducing something different and exciting in the ever-growing Atlanta food scene!

The wing was crispy,  juicy; and flavorful, but the chicken breast was over cooked and super dried even the sauce couldn't help it.  The kimchi Mac & Cheese was salty, sour, creamy; and usually delicious.  The cheese corn was not creamy and watery because the cheese did not melted but the favor was good.  Service was excellent!

photos.caption: Chicken, Kimchi Mac & Cheese, and Cheese Corn

comment.text:
Mukja was an amazing experience, the chicken wings were crispy and tasty and the service was good as well. We went on a Saturday afternoon right before a rush and they met our expectations, however...please don't forget your wallet because I felt it was a little pricey for the offerings. But I understand they have a business to run, the cost won't be a deterrent for me. 

If your wondering around Peachtree street looking for a different experience, give Mukja a try.

What a nice neighborhood find this restaurant was! We absolutely loved everything. We came here on a whim and never expected to have such a wonderful tasting meal. The chicken was cooked perfectly with a nice crunch on the outside but juicy and tender inside. All of our sides were absolutely delicious, the fries were awesome and the service was super friendly and nice. The restaurant is quite large and very clean with a cool atmosphere. 
I also like that It's a family owned business! Definitely recommend it

photos.caption: Whole birds with corn, loaded fries, slaw, salad, Mac and cheese and sauces.

comment.text: Fire. Word to the wise- the Standard has huge cuts of onion, if you're not a fan I'd recommend the slaw instead. I usually don't care for cabbage kimchi but it was great in the mac n cheese. I'll be back.

Just tried Mukja . Have to say honestly it's over priced fast food. I got a half bird and it come with 3 sides and one sauce. 
My chicken must have been a very small bird. Maybe a Quail haha. A lot of the chicken was very dry. My sides were max n cheese, fries and the slaw. The slaw was good. Max n cheese was pretty flavorless and mushy. 
I'm giving it 3 stars because the soy- garlic sauce was great and helped with the dry pieces. They should really toss the chicken in your desired sauce instead of giving it to you on side. $30 for a small chicken and sides for one person is ridiculous.

photos.caption: The smallest half chicken. Mostly dry as well

comment.text: Good food fast!!! Staff was polite and Knowledgeable about their menu. Atmosphere was inviting and music welcomed all genre's.  I noticed a lot of  door dash and walk in orders which is a good sign food is good, and it was. First time here will not be the last. Some of the best chicken tenders and cheese corn I've ever had, and their "Come back" sauce was really good...reminds you of Zax sauce but 10x better. Located in Midtown, was here for a function, will visit again when in the area.

Dropped in on a Sunday & got the tendies, 2-piece quarter chicken & loaded fries. The food was pretty good. I enjoyed the tendies & sauce. My husband mentioned the quarter chicken dark meat was really good. He got a honey sauce that was quite spicy & Korean sauce to dip in. He did not want to share at all he liked it so much lol. The sides are Korean dishes & I really enjoyed the Standard which was a slaw with corn, husband got the man n cheese which had a kick. I'd definitely try this place again & get the quarter chicken.

I tried this place today after seeing someone give a really great review on Instagram. Maybe that person was great with camera angles because my food did not come out looking like that and I was underwhelmed by the experience. 

I ordered the cheesy corn, which was more like a creamed corn ( and yes I have had Korean cheesy corn several times in different places), the corn was overcooked, and wasn't really that flavorful or tasty. The wings were tiny! I usually go to Yumbii for Korean style wings and I'm so mad at myself that I tried this place out because I finished my food feeling very unsatisfied. They had a nice crunch to them, but they were a little too chewy for my taste.

The best part was the comeback sauce to be honest. I likely won't be back.

I was looking for fried chicken today.  I love me some Korean fried chicken.  So I decided to try this place today. It's not far from where I work.  So why not. First off, it was hard picking sides for me. My fault.  Not theres.  I don't like raw onion 
 So I decided on the fries and Mac and cheese. The Mac is sold with kimchi on it. I like kimchi but don't love it yet. So I decided against having it put on. I know I could have asked for it on the side, but I didn't think of that. I don't believe it would have helped this Mac and cheese.  Second, the seasoning on the fried chicken was delicious.  So crispy and delicious.  The thing is, you need to cook chicken.  The leg was good until the end and the meat was pink. No way. I pulled the thigh apart.  Same. Pink. That is not a good look for chicken.  Third, the fries were really good. My takeaway,  cook the chicken longer.  I won't get the Mac. I will try this place again though. I want to try the wings. I believe they're whole wings and you get 10. Not bad.

photos.caption: 2 piece dark meat chicken.  I already ate the leg.
That Mac is a no. The comeback sauce was great.

comment.text:
Chicken wings with Korean sauce is very delicious and crispy!

But the cheese corn is upsetting and very salty. The oil separated and was not good. Wouldn't order the corn.

This is an absolutely phenomenal place to eat out. The restaurant is slightly difficult to find as it is on a side street without a clear sign, but is conveniently right next to the parking garage. The atmosphere is lively with music playing and the employees are really nice and helpful. You do order and pick up at the counter when they call you (they do not serve themselves). 
The food is absolutely amazing. We got the bird on a bun with sweet heat sauce on one and comeback sauce on the second. Both sauces were excellent  in their own way. Personally I was not a fan of the kimchi on the Mac & cheese, but the loaded fries were a great side. Bonus points for having halal food!

photos.caption: Bird on a bun. Mac&cheese. Loaded fries.

comment.text:
This place is great! I used to not be a huge fan because the sides, in all honesty, were not very good. I had tried both the mac and cheese and the corn, and both were a turn-off all of the multiple times I went. And I'm not a super picky person (I'd like to think lol).

I went again today after not having been in awhile and was pleasantly surprised. I think they must have revamped their food. There was a huge improvement/change in the main dishes and sides. They weren't just no longer strange tasting - they were delicious.

The inside is really fun, and outside of the issue I had in the past with the food itself, it's always been a good spot imo.

They validate parking (you have to park in the garage that is attached to the building that Sweet Hut also uses). If you park in the deck to the left they can't validate that.

Will be back! It's not too busy during the lunch rush

Food is bomb, there is a parking deck near by so no worries on the parking (especially it being Atlanta)! Customer service is good usually. Definitely a cool little spot. Definitely try out if you are near the area.

The place inside is nice and clean. We ordered the chicken sandwich with fries and Mac/cheese. Halal chicken for the win! I didn't understand what was Korean about the fried chicken, the only thing they added was kimchi on top and two buns. The chicken was burnt. The fries were well salted and cooked. The Mac and cheese was creamy, but the flavor tasted like there was bacon in it. It looked like there were some pieces of bacon in the Mac and cheese, I asked the guy several times he said no, this what Gouda cheese looks like. I don't eat bacon so I had to make sure, because it tasted like there was pork flavoring used. I looked at Yelp reviews and they have asked for bacon to be removed before ordering it. I went back to the cashier to ask him again and showed him the pieces of it, he's like that what Gouda cheese rinds. I didn't feel comfortable eating it, so I switched it out for fries. 

Not sure if I ordered something wrong but it was avg. I had better places

Absolutely top 3 place to eat in Atlanta, friendly staff that's works promptly to satisfy all of our needs, great recommendations and knowledge on all options and sauces. 
The Chicken is cooked to beyond perfection, so crispy and juicy it's honestly insane and who knows how they do it but it's just incredible all the time. The sides too are just as good and compliment the delicious Chicken in such a way that's it's just unbelievable. 
My number one recommended place in ATL and will be going back as often as possible when I'm in town.

I had the the delight of being treated for lunch by my Eldest Son today, and OMGGGGG what a wonderful dining experience!

Customer Service: 
Taste of food: 
Time to get food: 
Cleanliness of restaurant & ladies room: 

We both thoroughly enjoyed our Sunday afternoon outing! I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Korean fried chicken & loaded fries, complimentary side of kimchi
Korean Loaded Fries & Korean fried chicken

comment.text:
I'd never heard about Mukja Korean Fried chicken until the YES! event earlier this year.  When I visited to pick up my yes meal, I also decided since I was there that I should pick up dinner, so I ordered myself a 10 piece of their KFC wings to go (14).

The 10 piece also comes with pickled radish, French fries and sauce of your choice.  So how did I like the food?  Well it's a bit mixed for me.  I'm trying to not bring my experience with the YES meal in this review, but the fried chicken dark were breaded nicely, were crispy and man they hit it out of the park for me.

Here's the thing...the KFC wings were not the best wings i've had.  I think they were over breaded and while they were crispy, it was really hard to eat them without pulling some of the skin off from the grease factor (and that's the main reason for KFC wings is the skin!).  

The sauces were hit or miss for me as well.  The honey butter was very sweet and tasted exactly like honey and, well, butter.  I didn't have much of this sauce.  The spicy sauce was much less sweet but also not spicy.  To their credit, staff did say they were working on a habanero sauce because they'd heard comments about customers wanting something a bit more spicy.  Kudos to them for that...i'll have to try it the next time I visit.

French fries were good.  Crispy, well salted and went well with the dipping sauces.

The interior of Mukja is really nice, clean and bright.  and there's a good amount of seating/tables for dine in.  Located at the corner of Peachtree st and peachtree pl, you can find Mukja just behind the Taco mac.  Parking was not an issue for me.  I parked at my old apt off of 5th street and just walked there.  But there's several street parking spots that are local to the restaurant as well.

I do want Mukja to succeed so even though I think this experience is a 3.5 I'll round them up to 4 stars. I am certain that i'll go back again just to give them another shot, because like I mentioned earlier, I ordered two separate dishes at the same time (both fried chicken of some sort), and while one was amazing, the other was just heavily breaded and hard to finish.  I hope the next time I visit everything I try will be amazing and I can bump them up a star or two.  I hope you give them a shot if you're nearby!

The real "KFC" lives, forget Kentucky, Korean Fried Chicken is the real move. If you've never had Korean fried chicken, you're absolutely missing out and I'm so sad for you. But luckily, there are awesome restaurants like Mukja that are a great option for your first crunchy bite of chicken magic right here in the A.

Despite loving any reason to dress up and enjoy a meal outside of my home, I'm a big delivery-ordering kinda girl since I'm lazy, lol. So when I saw Mukja being featured on an app and highlighting their great reviews, I decided to check them out. What a fabulous choice because, wow. My first couple of orders, I went with their wings, fries and Mac & Cheese (like, same order x 3 lol) and became hooked! The Mac and Cheese topped with Kimchi? FIRE. It's sooo difficult for me to find Mac and Cheese that I like if it isn't made at somebody's aunties house. But Mukja's Mac is so good! The Kimchi topping is a perfect match, *chefs kiss*

And the wings? Babyyy. The crunchy skin offers up a crispy first bite before you enjoy the juicy wing as a whole and lose your damn mind. I mean, there's love in that marinade and batter!! And I know that there's been a chicken shortage in the world and some restaurants' wings really show that. Not at Mukja. Each wing has been well-sized and juicy, like they were prepped on a farm just for me *insert teary-eyed emoji here*. Ugh, see, there goes that vegetarian diet I'll never actually make happen. Oh well, more chicken for me!

Overall, interesting experience. The service was great, food came out quickly but the food itself felt overpriced and underwhelming. The menu is very small and options are very limited, so be prepared. We got half of the bird with the side of Korean slaw, Mac and cheese, pickled radish and fries. The bird was good and the Korean slaw was pretty spicy. Fries and Mac and cheese were fine. It felt like the sauce wasn't evenly distributed but rather clumped to the center of the slaw, making an awkward texture. The place has a fast-food style seating and felt very KFC. I wish they had kimchi or something else more traditional but that's my personal preference!

Yum. Mukja is a delicious blend of Korean + American. It is located right in the heart of Midtown and offers a selection of some delicious fried chicken with a Korean twist. From my time in Atlanta, this was one, if not is, my favorite Korean Fried Chicken place. 

Ordered
- Whole Bird with Sides (5/5). So tasty! I love the crispiness of the chicken and how big and succulent it is. The sides are on-point too, from the kimchi-infused coleslaw to the southern style mac n' cheese, this is a great value meal for the family 

Note: only giving a 4/5 since there was one stance when the chicken was very undercooked and we had to air fry it again

I would go back to this place and try the other dishes like the chicken sandwich. So many good options!

We ordered the half chicken, 10 wings, mac n cheese, fries, and creamed corn for delivery.  We love the light crispiness & the flavor of the chicken.  It's one of the best fried chicken I've had.  The sides are very good too but the chicken was exceptional.  Will definitely order again when visiting Atlanta.  Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: 10  wings , Half chicken, fries Mac n cheese with kimchi, creamed corn

comment.text: Had a second try and the chicken was great. Along  with the mac & cheese, fries, and slaw. The owner was so very nice and gave me another meal to replace the first one. Everything was excellent!

Oh my gosh, their food is amazing! So easy to order online and then pick up the food. Their wings are to die for and their Korean slaw is just fabulous. If you haven't been, You need to give them a try ASAP. Friendly staff and you never have to wait long for your food.  Totally yummy!!!

On a quiet street near Sweet Hut is a cute little shop, clean and inviting looking from outside. Mukja Korean Fried Chicken is an amazing add to the ATL area. My husband and I were so excited to try it - and the chicken is halal! 
(Note: Sean, one of the owners at the front counter, clarified that it's the fried chicken pieces right now that are halal - the chicken for the wings and the bird on a bun are not, so best be sure to ask when you come in. There is also bacon in the bowl as well as the Mac and cheese, though you can request for that to be removed in the Mac). 

-ambience: the interior is really cute - even though it's a fast casual place, it was really clean and the interior decorations added a nice touch - clearly, enthusiastic about Korean culture and good food. They have some high tops and a few tables with benches for those who would like to dine in, all clean. Even the bathroom was spotless! 5/5

-service: Sean, one of the owners, was our main POC while there and was really awesome and welcoming! He took the time to explain to us all the halal options, the different sauce flavor profiles, and he brought the food to our table and checked in on us to see how everything was. It was amazing service, he really made us feel at home! 5/5

-food: OMG, I am just glad it's a bit of a drive, or else I'd be here daily for dinner! The fried chicken is super fresh, perfectly crispy, and goes really well with the sauces. We got both dark and white meat, and both hit the spot! The fries were really good too, nice and crispy. There were several sauces that we tried - the comeback (thousand island like), the A-T hell (habanero with a hint of sweet) and soy garlic (similar to standard Chinese style sauce). My favorite was the A-T hell! 
They also provide sides with the meal - the pickled radish and the Korean slaw were delicious, and the Mac and cheese was solid too. 5/5
The chicken orders are a little on the small side - my husband and I ordered a half bird, and then we went back to order another quarter, because we were fighting over the last chicken piece and still had room for more. 

Best be sure, we will be back. A solid KFC in ATL!! And it's halal - what not to like??

photos.caption: Sauces - from top to bottom: comeback sauce (thousand-island like),  "A-T-HELL"sauce (spicy, with a hint of sweet), Soy Garlic sauce
Mac and cheese and Korean Slaw
Half bird with fries and sauces

comment.text:
Mukja is dank. Solid addition to Midtown, although a little hidden on a side street next to Taco Mac. Came for a late lunch and had no wait around 3pm; menu is short and straightforward, and we got our food quickly after ordering.

Myself and my two friends ate indoors as it wasn't very busy, and it's a fairly open space in terms of seating. We all got chicken sandwiches; I got it with mac n cheese and my friends got theirs with fries and slaw.

The chicken is super crispy on the outside and juicy inside; not spicy or anything (I like some heat myself) but very flavorful with the sauce, which is like an upgraded Zaxby's sauce. I like that the sandwich wasn't super heavy, but still filling! The mac n cheese was VERY gouda forward, but that is gouda for me (ha ha). My friend loved her slaw - not the creamy kind, but it was super fresh. Fries were what you would expect; note they are steak cut.

All in all, good meal for $12 - glad I was able to stop by while back in ATL, and would revisit next time I return!

My husband and I were downtown for an concert and we needed something quick to grab Mukja popped up and we love Korean Fried Chicken. Parking is free around this area for 1 hour or so I believe. This was the most friendly experience ever . We needed help with the menu our first time, the gentleman HELPED SO SO MUCH . His nice attitude was everything! 
We had 10 wings combo & Half Bird with Beer. I had to try all of their sauces. My favorite Comeback Sauce, my husbands favorite was Korean Sweet one. Food so fresh and crispy loved it. Every time I pass by MidTown I plan on stopping there. 
Thank you for giving us a memorable experience and it was an amazing atmosphere. Songs they play to decorations on the wall.
10/10

This definitely would've been better not delivered, but the Mukja Bowl wasn't too bad! The dish was very tasty, and the fries are pretty good. I've heard good things about the fried chicken, so I'll have to try that next time.

Nothing special unfortunately. Found this place amongst tiktok but it didn't reach my expectations. The kimchi Mac and cheese I wouldn't order again but the wings were fair. Wings needed more flavor and sauces needed to be a little less sweet. There was attentive service and the ambiance of the restaurant was modern and clean. However, the food just wasn't there for me.

Stopped by here for a quick lunch and ordered the 2 pieces of dark meat chicken and I got the Mac n cheese and the coleslaw. The chicken itself was just okay in my opinion and the sauces didn't really add anything other then some saltiness from soy sauce. One of the pieces of chicken actually wasn't fully cooked in the middle which made me not able to finish the whole chicken. Honestly the best thing about this place was the coleslaw. It was so unique and the sauce had gochujang in it I believe which have it a very complex flavor. The Mac n cheese itself was good but want a big fan of the kimchi on top of it. Not really a big kimchi fan so not the best judge of it. I would literally just come back here for the coleslaw that it was that good. Little pricey too for only getting two pieces of fried chicken.
So great!! Ordered online on a rainy day & picked up - it was cooked and packaged to perfection. Will definitely return!

photos.caption: Chicken sandwich with Korean Loaded Fries

comment.text: It was my first time trying Mukja. I had the fried tofu nuggets and coleslaw being that I'm working on changing my diet. The tofu was so tender still and had lite crispy fried taste and sauce was delicious. Coleslaw sauce tad spicy which I love spice. I really appreciate our staff member referring and making this order happen at our school today. I'll be in soon to get dinner for my family one day soon. #educators #freshfood
